body:
@jwang98052 I've done a pass.

@anupam128 How close are we with the real APIs? This touches on a lot of code in many ways we will likely have to undo once that lands. If that is just around the corner, it might make sense not to merge this at all.
@anupam128 This looks good, just needs some additional documentation. Thanks!

I have addressed review comments and pushed in the change. 

@markusweimer @anupam128 
This branch now is used in many places in our other effort cross different source depots. It is very easy to be out of sync and miss something if it is kept in a branch. I would strongly think we should merge it to master to bring the effort to current. I have labeled all the necessary places as [unstable] and put TODO with Jira numbers. Checking it in would force any future changes to ensure regression testing pass and the scenarios we support today should be still supported.

Even after Rest API is ready, some of the code may still be needed, such ad tracking URL for local run time, pull url result, etc. Some of the classes we added in this PR will remain. For example, MultipleRMUrlProvider is just another provider and it is useful and generic. FinalState would remain as it is needed for Rest API as well.

OK, let's move forward with this. Before we can merge this, we need to resolve two issues:
1. The code doesn't rebase cleanly onto current `master`. Julia, can you clean that up?
2. We need to test .NET code on both local and YARN
I will follow up on those two. In fact, I have been keep testing it on local and yarn before every push. I will do it again after rebase.
Thanks @afchung! I have made the changes.
This looks good, only minor comments. @anupam128 Could you resolve the conflicts?
Thanks @afchung ! I have resolved the conflicts and made the changes.

This looks good. [REEF-187](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-187) should include tests for this. I'll merge this. @gyeongin Next time, you should use the actual jira number instead of "JIRA_ISSUE_NUMBER" in the commit message.
I will test and merge.
I will review it.
I think I left out some changes; I'll push another commit soon.

Thank you for detail explanation. I've reviewed current Mesos runtime implementation more to do that. But, according to the initial documents, I still think this comments means how to get parameters for the existing Mesos Cluster slaves if they are configured not to use 5051.

```
-  private static final int MESOS_SLAVE_PORT = 5051;
-  //  Assumes for now that all slaves use port 5051(default) TODO: make it configurable.
```

We are launching `MesosRemoteManager`, `REEFScheduler`, `REEFExecutor`, but not `mesos-slave` daemon (whose default port is 5051). 

If you are considering `MesosRemoteManager`, I found that `RangeTcpPortProvider` is already applied during Injection. Do you suggest to configure this `portRangeBegin`, `portRangeCount`, and `portRangeTryCount` for `MesosRemoteManager`? If then, I can create another issue for that.

```
this.raw = remoteManagerFactory.getInstance("MESOS_EXECUTOR", codec, mesosErrorHandler);
```

```
17:18:40,652 FINE ... Instantiating RangeTcpPortProvider{portRangeBegin=10000, portRangeCount=10000, portRangeTryCount=1000}
```

Thank you again.
@anupam128 Seems like there are still conflicts. Can you take a look? Thanks!
@anupam128 Please resolve the conflicts and I'll take a look. Thanks!
This leaves my area of expertise, as I have not worked on the mesos layer myself. @johnyangk can you chime in?
`RunSimpleEventHandlerOnLocalRuntime` fails on my machine, but it is unrelated to your changes, since I've tested on a clean repository. Merged. Thanks @anupam128!
This looks good. I will merge.
@afchung I have resolved the conflicts and made changes.
@afchung Resolved conflicts. Thanks.
In general changes LGTM. I would suggest you to add unittests for appropriate logic.
I've added Unstable annotations to public classes in alll reef.io.watcher, thanks @afchung
I am done my pass.

Thank you for working on this! 

I think two different concepts are mixed here.
1. MESOS_SLAVE_PORT
   - Mesos slave is a long running process which serves a similar purpose as NodeManager in YARN. MESOS_SLAVE_PORT represents the port number of Mesos slaves and used for building a node descriptor. This node descriptor is stored in `ResourceCatalog`, an interface I believe REEF users query against to obtain available node/rack information.
   - Then why the constant number 5051? Unlike YARN API, which provides the port numbers of NodeManagers, Mesos API does not provide the port numbers of Mesos slaves. Thus, I settled with 5051(the default) assuming it as the common case. Note that making the number configurable doesn't completely solve the problem, as Mesos slaves can be configured to use different ports.
   - My questions: what's the use of exposing to REEF users Mesos Slave/NodeManager hostname/port information through `ResourceCatalog`? Also the comments in `NodeDescriptor` says as if the class describes an Evaluator's inet address, isn't this wrong? Am I missing something here?
2. MesosRemoteManager
   - This is a little hack I did to work around some problems I had in making REEF semantics work with Mesos API. I see that it is using a deprecated constructor. I'm currently looking into how to do without this. 
   - Meanwhile, as it does work, I think we can leave it as is for now.

Thankn you very much, @johnyangk .

Then, as a author of the following comment, why do you leave the following TODO comments? I thought it is reasonable because Mesos supports custom port setups like 5050(master port)/5051(slave port) with parameters and administrators do not change them after installation in industry. 

```
-  private static final int MESOS_SLAVE_PORT = 5051;
-  //  Assumes for now that all slaves use port 5051(default) TODO: make it configurable.
```

In any way, we should remove the following TODO comments for REEF developers or revise them and file a Jira Issue for that.

@dongjoon-hyun Right, the common case should be the port should be same across Mesos slaves. I do think making it configurable is much better than using the constant number as we do now. I think the PR addresses the problem well.

I'm just not sure about the use of Mesos Slave/NodeManager hostname/port information in the first place, although other information in `NodeDescriptor` such as nodeid, rack, and memory seems to be useful.

But I guess as my concern is orthogonal to this issue, I can maybe create a new jira issue for that and discuss there.

I think the PR looks good to be merged. @markusweimer, any further comments?
@gwsshs22 Thanks! I will test and merge.
@anupam128 This looks good, I will test and merge tomorrow. Thanks!
Thank you, @johnyangk . By the way, for the Mesos, what version do you use now?
This looks good to me.

@dongjoon-hyun I don't really have a running Mesos cluster. I am fine with bumping up the Mesos version in pom.xml if needed. I believe the version we have is 0.21.0 while their most recent version is 0.25.0.

What's the final resolution? Do we use the same port number of do we use
TcpPortProvider?

On Fri, Nov 13, 2015 at 1:17 PM, John Yang notifications@github.com wrote:

> @dongjoon-hyun https://github.com/dongjoon-hyun I don't really have a
> running Mesos cluster. I am fine with bumping up the Mesos version in
> pom.xml if needed. I believe the version we have is 0.21.0 while their most
> recent version is 0.25.0.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/626#issuecomment-156317933
> .

## 

Byung-Gon Chun

The final resolution is using the same port number since it's the port number of the existing Mesos cluster. 
After upgrading to the latest version of Mesos, I'll investigate further in order to retrieve Slave port from Mesos master.
@dongjoon-hyun Sounds good to me.
@bgchun , @dafrista , @johnyangk . Could anyone of you test this on Linux and merge, please?

Strangely, with the first commit `WatcherTest` failed in Jenkins due to a timeout(1min). Just to make sure, I ran this patch on my machine and the test passed. Either there's a heisenbug or Jenkins is not working properly. Let's see how the second commit goes.

Yep. That would be Jenkins Windows issue. So, I retrigger it with the same contents.
Looks good. I will merge.

Thank you, @johnyangk . For Ubuntu/Mac, you can run cluster easily. For running `runmesostests.sh`, as you know, Docker Tools on Mac uses only one VM for docker(default: 2GB RAM, 1 core). You may need to setup the VM with 4 core and 4GB in Oracle VirtualBox. It is due to `CloseEvaluatorDriver` requiring 16 evaluators.
Thank you, @johnyangk .
@dongjoon-hyun Thanks for the tip. I'll test on Ubuntu and let you know how it goes.
@dongjoon-hyun Seems that #634 conflicts with this PR? Can you please take a look?

@dongjoon-hyun 

I tested with `/run-cluster.sh reefrt/hdi3.2` on Ubuntu. The YARN tests passed. However I was not able to run Mesos tests due to MESOS_NATIVE_LIBRARY not found error. I've left some comments, please take a look.
This looks good (besides a minor comment). However, it would be good to have a test for this that makes sure we never loose this functionality by accident.
Thank you. Now, I rebased to the master.

Thank you, @johnyangk . By the way, could you check if you are running `runmesostests.sh` on reefrt/hdi3.2 ?

`runmesostests.sh` should be tested on Mesos images (reefrt/mesos0.25 or the others). It's intentional for an test isolation.
Sorry, but I rebased to the master, too. You should download this PR again.
It looks good to me. I'll merge this.
Could you also publish the site afterwards? I'd like to get more data points for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-885 - is it only my problem, or does it occur for others as well?

Oh, yes. I will do publish together. For REEF-885, I'm crossing my finger that it does not occur to me. :)
Anyway, if it occurs again, I will fix that and leave a note for you.

I finished. According to the direction, if there is no newly updated javadoc, we can ignore `apidoc`.

```
$ ./publish.sh

Shell script for uploading REEF website contents to Apache SVN!
Newly updated javadocs (if there is any) should be in the directory:
  $REEF_HOME/website/target/staging/site/apidocs/${reef.version}
Please run this script in $REEF_HOME/website.
```

So, as a test, I do not make `apidocs`. It works and looks safe for non-apidocs updates. I think you can try this someday later.

```
$REEF_HOME/website/target/staging/site/apidocs/
```

Looks good, I will merge.

@afchung Thanks. Could you please merge? :)

Also it would be great if you could close REEF-931 as well, since REEF-935 seems to be its only sub-task.
This is ready for a review.

I'll do a pass.
LGTM. I saw a few extra lines, that I can remove while merging.

@dongjoon-hyun Yes I've just finished testing all the images on a Ubuntu machine. The tests all pass. I'll merge this patch. Thank you!
Thank you!

Since this is the third implementation of IFileSystem and the first genuine one I believe we should take a moment to get the exception handling and contract correct here.
Any code using IFileSystem should ideally work agnostic of underlying implementation. To this end, we will have to be very crisp at the IFileSystem API layer of which methods throw what exceptions. Writing code against IFileSystem and correctly handling the exceptions would be very difficult if every implementation throws its own type of exceptions.
It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.

Hi, @johnyangk . I think you're the best person to review this. :) 
If I misunderstood something, please correct me.

```
Failed tests: 
  NameClientTest.testLookup:151 Execution Exception cause is instanceof NamingException
```

A test on Windows failed, but it doesn't seem to be caused by this patch. I'll merge.
Thank you, @johnyangk .
With this change in effect, can we still reliably distinguish between "not set" and "set to be the empty string"?
@dkm2110 Can you please close this? We need to discuss the design on the JIRA first.
I'll test and merge.

Yes. This works exactly the same manner with previous Tang. The only difference is "NOT SET" will be determined by equality tests with the MAGIC string, "__REEF_UNINITIALIZED_VALUE__", instead of empty string. 

If you have something unreliable in your mind, could you give me some test examples? That will be very helpful for me.
I would like to review it as well.

I will be closing this in favor of implementing an IFileSystem for Block Blobs only. This is done mainly to:
1. Improve efficiency such that we don't have to make a round trip to the server every time we get a blob reference.
2. Improve consistency across calls. For example, as of the current PR, if we do copy from blob to local, if the blob is a PageBlob, it will work. However, if we do copy between blobs, and if the source blob is a PageBlob and the dest blob is a BlockBlob (by default), the method will fail.
Switching to a blob-type specific implementation will rid both of these problems.
I completed my pass.
